tickets.subject: RE: Tip of the Week: Sign up for Personalized Training with a Remote One-On-One
tickets.raw_subject: RE: Tip of the Week: Sign up for Personalized Training with a Remote One-On-One
tickets.description:
Hi,

 

Are you training property alerts through Real Scout?

 

 

 

Carol Hennessy

Office Administrator

chennessy@apr.com | 408.913.7925

Alain Pinel Realtors® Saratoga

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

From: Training Center APR
Sent: Wednesday, May 16, 2018 5:04 PM
To: All Of The APR Offices <AllAPR@apr.com>
Subject: Tip of the Week: Sign up for Personalized Training with a Remote One-On-One

 

PERSONALIZED TRAINING WITH A REMOTE ONE-ON-ONE  

 

 

Remote One-On-Ones are offered every Friday from 10:30 to 2:00pm.

The GREEN dot shows the slot is open. The PINK dot shows it has been taken.

 

1. In SAVI, click the Training tab on the top black navigation bar > choose The Academy tile > select the Calendar tab on the top navigation bar.

2.      Click on the day and time that’s right for you > REGISTER.

 

The day before your training, you’ll receive a reminder email. A trainer will call you at the time of your appointment and will use GoToMeeting to connect with you. You’ll be able to see her screen.

 

Popular topics for One-On-Ones are: CMA, Newsletters, eFlyers, Websites, Property Alerts, Xpressdocs, Facebook and LinkedIn.

  

 ……………………………………………

 

QUESTIONS ABOUT ADWERX DIGITAL MARKETING?

 

Sign up for classroom training next week for “ADWERKS” and get some tips from a Technical Trainer. Visit savi.apr.com > Training tab > The Academy > Calendar to find the right location and time for you.

 

APR TRAINING

training@apr.com

tickets.subject: Fw: Open house for 333 Bush Sat/Sun
tickets.raw_subject: Fw: Open house for 333 Bush Sat/Sun
tickets.description:
My email account is blocked from sending all hands emails.  This is my third request for assistance.


Denise L. Paulson
Portfolio Real Estate Advisor
345 Spear St., Ste. 120, SF, CA 94105
apr.com/dpaulson
Top Agent Network Member
415.860.0718 direct
linkedin.com/in/denisepaulson

I have not and will not verify or investigate the information supplied by third parties.






________________________________
From: Microsoft Outlook
Sent: Thursday, May 17, 2018 1:04 AM
To: All San Francisco Offices
Subject: Undeliverable: Open house for 333 Bush Sat/Sun

[http://products.office.com/en-us/CMSImages/Office365Logo_Orange.png?version=b8d100a9-0a8b-8e6a-88e1-ef488fee0470]
Your message to the group AllSanFranciscoOffices@apr.com couldn't be delivered.

The group AllSanFranciscoOffices only accepts messages from people on its allowed senders list, and your email address isn't on the list.

dpaulson        Office 365      AllSanFranciscoOffic. . .
Sender          Action Required


                Sender not allowed


How to Fix It
Ask the owner of the group to grant you permission to send to the group, and then try to send a message again. If the group belongs to a different organization than yours, contact the organization's customer service department for assistance. If the group is in your organization and you don't know who the group owner is, you can find it by doing the following in either Outlook on the web or Outlook:

  *   Open your Sent folder, and then select the original message.
  *   If you're using Outlook on the web, select the group name located on the To or CC line. If you're using Outlook, double-click the group name on the To or CC line.
  *   In Outlook on the web, from the pop-up dialog box, choose Owner. In Outlook, choose Contact. The owner's name is listed under Owner.


The owner of the group may have intentionally chosen to restrict who can send messages to it, and they may not want to adjust the existing restriction. In this case, you'll have to contact the group members by some other means, such as sending an email message to their individual email addresses or contacting them by phone.


Was this helpful? Send feedback to Microsoft<https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=525931>.
________________________________


More Info for Email Admins
Status code: 550 5.7.124

This error occurs when the owner of the distribution group or security group has set up the group to accept messages only from certain addresses. Even a group owner may not be automatically granted permission to send messages to the group.

To fix this issue, the group owner must add the sender's address to the group's allowed senders list. Usually this issue can only be fixed by the group owner.

For more information and steps to fix this issue, see Fix email delivery issues for error code 5.7.124 in Office 365<https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=532892>.


Original Message Details
Created Date:   5/17/2018 8:04:02 AM
Sender Address: dpaulson@apr.com
Recipient Address:      AllSanFranciscoOffices@apr.com
Subject:        Open house for 333 Bush Sat/Sun


Error Details
Reported error: 550 5.7.124 RESOLVER.RST.RestrictedToGroupPermission; not authorized to send to the distribution list because the distribution list is set up to accept mail from list members only, or specific recipients only
